intro: Phyllanthus claussenii var. oblongifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf phyllanthus, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It features small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged alternately along its stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule containing several small, hard seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
